result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Anthony Vaughn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will waive all costs and surcharges that can be waived. Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by 11-09-15 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
Release privileges for the Day Reporting Center; Sentence STAYED to 09-18-15 by 5pm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick Anthony Vaughn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick Anthony Vaughn in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 10 days served; release privileges for the Day Reporting Center; sentence stayed to September 18, 2015 by 5:00 pm.  Court will waive all costs and surcharges that can be waived.  Court ordered all mandatory costs and surcharges to be paid by November 9, 2015 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed:  Discharge Summary.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Derrick Anthony Vaughn in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM034965  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/25/2015

BRANCH 47 FOR BRANCH 24
Defendant Derrick Anthony Vaughn in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Derrick Anthony Vaughn in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Plea Hearing. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24. Case calendared off master calendar.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Derrick Anthony Vaughn in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Derrick Anthony Vaughn in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Defense requests a "speedy  plea."  Branch 24 is down.  Court adjourns matter before the pair Judge.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
